original: LAGERLÖF, Gari, Försäkringsdirektör, Stockholm, f Tåby, Ögl, 5/4 78 av tullförv, v hhövd Joh L o Clara de Broen, gm Ninni Rubenson. Stud Sthlm. Anst hdlskont Sthlm o Hamburg 98, tjm brandförs.AB Fenix 99, kamr 08, v. vkst dir sed. 27. Försäkr.stud Zurich o Strassburg 02, London 06. RVO, Brandförsäkr.AB Fenix’ GM. °LAGERLÖF, Hans, Affärsman, New York, USA, f Tåby, Ögl, 29/3 80 av tullförv o v. hhövd J L o Clara de Broen, gm Clara Lenz. Stat hdlsstip f USA 03. Bild Scand Axner Trading Co 07, en av inkorporatörerna i Sv hdlskamm i New York 07, start fma Lager-loef Trading Co Inc New York 18. Donat t postmus i Sthlm. •LAGERLÖW, Carl-Hilmer, Civilingenjör, Stockholm, f Gbg 1/4 77 av bokbind C E L o Hilma Quick, gm Ilse Hofmann. Mog.ex Högre reallärov Gbg 97, ex CTL (mask o bergs) 00. Anst AB Eminent Gbg 00—02, G E Berggrens Mek Verkst Helsingfors 02—05, Carl Hansson Gbg 06, Värmeledn AB Celsius Gbg 06—08, förest värmetekn avd AB Ahlsell & Ahrens Sthlm 08—13, eg värmetekn agent.fma 14—17, ch värmetekn avd AB Ahlsell & Bernström Sthlm sed. 18. Styr.led AB Sv Strebel-vkn sed. 33. Led Sv Tekn.frn. L har patent på bl a de s.k. nischradiatorerna o introduc i Sv o tillv prof Junkers varmluftsapparater.
translated:
LAGERLÖF, Gari, Insurance Director, Stockholm, born in Tåby, Ögl, on 5/4 1878, son of customs officer, late Lieutenant Colonel Joh L and Clara de Broen, married to Ninni Rubenson. Studied in Stockholm. Employed at commercial offices in Stockholm and Hamburg in 1898, assistant at fire insurance company AB Fenix in 1899, clerk in 1908, vice managing director since 1927. Studied insurance in Zurich and Strasbourg in 1902, London in 1906. Received the Royal Victorian Order. General Manager of AB Fenix. 

LAGERLÖF, Hans, Businessman, New York, USA, born in Tåby, Ögl, on 29/3 1880, son of customs officer and retired Lieutenant Colonel J L and Clara de Broen, married to Clara Lenz. Received a business scholarship in the United States in 1903. Established Scand Axner Trading Co in 1907, one of the incorporators in the Swedish Chamber of Commerce in New York in 1907, started the company Lagerloef Trading Co Inc New York in 1918. Donated to the Postal Museum in Stockholm. 

LAGERLÖW, Carl-Hilmer, Civil Engineer, Stockholm, born in Gothenburg on 1/4 1877, son of bookbinder C E L and Hilma Quick, married to Ilse Hofmann. Graduated from Higher Real Gymnasium in Gothenburg in 1897, graduated in Mechanical and Mining Engineering in 1900. Employed at AB Eminent in Gothenburg from 1900 to 1902, G E Berggrens Mechanical Workshop in Helsinki from 1902 to 1905, Carl Hansson in Gothenburg in 1906, Värmeledn AB Celsius in Gothenburg from 1906 to 1908, head of heating technology department at AB Ahlsell & Ahrens in Stockholm from 1908 to 1913, owner of a heating technology agency from 1914 to 1917, chief of heating technology department at AB Ahlsell & Bernström in Stockholm since 1918. Member of the board of AB Sv Strebel-vkn since 1933. Member of the Swedish Technical Association. Lagerlöw holds patents on, among other things, the so-called niche radiators and introduced Junkers hot air heaters in Sweden.
